-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                 Release Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
An innovative and revolutionary animated classic from Walt Disney, combining 
Western classical music masterpieces with imaginative visuals, presented with 
Leopold Stokowski and the Philadelphia Orchestra. The eight animation sequences 
are colorful, impressive, free-flowing, abstract, and often surrealistic pieces. 
They include the most famous of all, Paul Dukas&#039;s "The Sorcerer&#039;s Apprentice" 
with Mickey Mouse as the title character battling brooms carrying endless 
buckets of water. Also included are J.S. Bach&#039;s "Toccata and Fugue in D Minor"; 
Tchaikovsky&#039;s "Nutcracker Suite"; dinosaurs and volcanoes in Stravinsky&#039;s "Rite 
of Spring"; the delightful "Dance of the Hours" by Ponchielli with dancing 
hippos, crocodiles, ostriches, and elephants; and Mussorgsky&#039;s darkly 
apocalyptic "Night on Bald Mountain."

Directors: James Algar
         : Samuel Armstrong

Writers  : Lee Blair
         : Elmer Plummer

Cast:

Leopold Stokowski ...  Himself (Conductor, The Philadelphia Orchestra) 
Deems Taylor ...  Narrator (1940 original) 
Julietta Novis ...  Soloist (segment "Ave Maria") (voice) 
Corey Burton ...  Narrator: Deems Taylor overdubs (2000 restoration) (voice) 
(uncredited) 

Walt Disney ...  Mickey Mouse (segment "The Sorcerer&#039;s Apprentice") (voice) 
(uncredited) 
James MacDonald ...  Percussionist (uncredited) 
Paul J. Smith ...  Violinist (uncredited 

Enjoy this mixture of classical music and animation.
